definition: to preserve/to save
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: The utility model thoroughly solves the wind-proof problem and the slide-proof problem; heavy equipment can not be damaged by the utility model.
sentences.chinese: 彻底解决了防风抗滑问题，保住重大设备不受损失。

sentences.english: Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny is determined to hold on to his Arsenal place next season.
sentences.chinese: 什琴斯尼下定决心要在下赛季保住他的首发地位。

sentences.english: This not only saves face it could save your job!
sentences.chinese: 这不仅能帮你挽回颜面，甚至还能帮你保住工作。

sentences.english: After that it was quiet for me and I managed to hold position.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后一切都正常，而且我设法保住了我的位置。

sentences.english: Only children homeschooled like Sylvie had the chance to live.
sentences.chinese: 只有那些像茜尔维这样在家学习的孩子才保住了命。

sentences.english: Being able to call a manicurist to your apartment would be the first step in guaranteeing yourself the job.
sentences.chinese: 为了保住这份工作，把修甲师约到你家将成为第一步。

sentences.english: Doing the job WRONG fourteen times gives you job security.
sentences.chinese: 连续十四次把工作做错让你保住工作。

sentences.english: The U.K. wasn't the only country that struggled to keep its ranking.
sentences.chinese: 英国并非唯一一个没有保住名次的国家。

sentences.english: Such discretion allowed him to retain his standing as the Empire rose to power.
sentences.chinese: 谨言慎行使他在帝国掌权时保住了自己的地位。

sentences.english: He builds a sand hill to save Grandma's house.
sentences.chinese: 他堆起了一座沙山来保住奶奶的房子。

sentences.english: However, there are also some leaders who dare not to talk much in order that their official position are safe.
sentences.chinese: 当然，也有部分领袖为了保住本身的官位而不敢呛声。

sentences.english: Captain Louie Perea says one twin died while the other survived with a single gunshot wound to her head, The Denver Post reports.
sentences.chinese: 警员说一人死亡，另一人头部中弹但是保住了性命。

sentences.english: Your best bet to win the first game in this matchup is just to do everything you can to maintain your life total.
sentences.chinese: 你首盘获胜的唯一赌注，就是尽可能地保住你的小命。

sentences.english: He swung the car to the left and that swerve saved Malone's life.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地将车头转向左边，这才保住了马隆的性命。

sentences.english: Stop the child or he will be falling over.
sentences.chinese: 保住孩子，他要脸朝下跌倒。

sentences.english: Protect state property, and the end is glorious Comrade sacrificed.
sentences.chinese: 国家财产保住了，尾生同志却光荣的牺牲了。

definition: to save from damage/to preserve/to maintain/to keep in good repair/(Tw) security guard
to save/to remedy/to rescue
to hold on to/to defend/to keep/to guard
cannot maintain (sth)/unable to keep/more likely than not/may well
life
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
imminent danger (idiom); approaching a crisis
to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
to withstand/to stand up to
to bring back to life
to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
luckily/by a fluke
to seek to protect/to ensure/to maintain/to guard
to save one's life/to survive
